12 year old me would have done horrible, unspeakable things for a game like this. 38 year old me DID horrible things, because gods help me, I have ALL the DLC.

Gripes first, there is at least one awesome battle from pretty much every movie that has a cutscene with no gameplay, and it's a huge bummer, because this game can handle stuff earlier ones couldn't. There's also several battles that could have been a cutscene and instead have tedious pace-breaking puzzles during high tension moments. Looking at you Cpt Phasma, you big shiny letdown. 

Last of the gripes, the melee combat is based around a new combo system that encourages mixing up attacks, basically by button mashing. It's actually kind of fun if it was limited to skilled opponents, but it creates of a leveling effect that has stormtroopers trading blows with jedi, while you will easily dispatch sith lords and assassins. It also takes WAY too many blaster shots to kill pretty much all enemies.

Ok, all that in mind, this game is trying hard to be the best Lego game ever, and it's NEARLY succeeding. This has all the best elements from previous Lego games. The exploration is vast and rewarding. Most of the levels integrate directly into the world around them. While the leveling combat feels questionable in story levels, it feels very appropriate while freely exploring the galaxy, which I think might be the point. I haven't encountered any COMPLETELY broken puzzles. Definitely some glitches, but so far nothing that required quitting or reloading to progress.

I don't know if Lego Skywalker is the BEST Lego game ever, but it's gotta be top 3, and it's definitely my favorite. This is like Lego Hobbit if they actually finished it instead of just having the game end at a totally arbitrary point in the story for no apparent reason.

The tight over the shoulder angle when shooting is really nice and elevates the experience by a lot. The game feels fast and arcadey, and it's really big. You can get lost unlocking everything and finding all the collectibles. There must be hours of content for a completionist. This is definitely worth picking up.

You can always find a specialized Star Wars game that is better (Squadrons, Jedi Fallen Order, etc) at one thing, but this game does a little bit of everything at a competent level. It's a Star Wars playground that I've always wanted as a kid.

I truly just disliked playing this game regardless. To even finish this game, not achievement hunt but just finish it, I somehow got burnout and had to return to it even with story and narrative to still experience with the assistance of external entertainment because of all these issues and then some.

The complaints I have towards achievement hunting however go further then the already mentioned issues. It's a SLOG, now this is where I believe i can start justifying having reasonable crash-out worth reactions to this game because no child is going to have the patience for 1200 of a singular collectable type, 140 side missions and another 300+ character, ships and mics collectables to collect let alone your average person because the only reason I found justification in achievement hunting this game is that I had already spent WAY too many hours playing it to NOT finish what I started.
